alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 28 at 1:54PM MDT until June 28 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Johnson County in north central Wyoming... * Until 230 PM MDT. * At 153 PM MDT, multiple severe thunderstorms were located 15 miles northwest of Fort Reno Historical Site, which is also 20 miles northeast of Kaycee, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Johnson County. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 76 and 78. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
